utils package¶

Submodules¶

utils.ArgumentReader module¶

class utils.ArgumentReader.ArgumentList¶

Bases: object

This class lists all of the arguments read from a command. There are three types of arguments: - Positional -> these are mandatory arguments for the command - Non positional -> these are given via the use of flags - Junk -> these are invalid arguments

Example: Let’s have a command ‘command’ that needs 1 positional argument and can have two non positional arguments set by the flags -a and -b.

!!command hello

This above is a valid use and will yield [hello] [] [] (resp. pos, non pos and junk).

!!command hello -a hi -b what

Still valid, will yield [hello] [(-a, hi), (-b, what)] [].

!!command -a hello hi

Still valid, will yield [hi] [(-a, hello)] []

!!command hello hi

Invalid, but still will yield something usebale [hello] [] [hi].

add_junk(arg)¶

Adds a new junk argument to the list of junk.

Parameters

arg – The argument to add.

add_non_pos(flag, arg)¶

Adds a new non positional argument and binds it to its corresponding flag. It does not add the argument if the flag is already set.

Parameters

  • flag – The flag of this argument.

  • arg – The argument to add.

Returns

True if the flag was not already set, False otherwise.

add_pos(arg)¶

Adds a new positional argument to the list of arguments.

Parameters

arg – The argument to add to the list.

get_junk(index)¶

Return the junk argument at the given index.

Parameters

index – The index of the junk argument to return.

Returns

The value of the junk argument at the given index, None if the index is invalid.

get_nb_pos()¶

Returns the number of positional arguments.

Returns

The current number of positional arguments.

get_non_pos(flag)¶

Returns the list of arguments bound to the given flag.

Parameters

flag – The flag to consider.

Returns

A list of argument if the flag is valid, None otherwise.

get_pos(index)¶

Return the positional argument at the given index.

Parameters

index – The index of the positional argument to return.

Returns

The value of the positional argument at the given index, None if the index is invalid.

is_flag_set(flag)¶

Checks if the given flag is already set.

Parameters

flag – The flag to check the existence of.

Returns

True if the flag is already set, False otherwise.

class utils.ArgumentReader.ArgumentReader¶

Bases: object

This class is used to read the arguments of a command. It parses all the different arguments and stores them depending on their position or the flag they are bound to.

classmethod read(arguments, flags, expected_pos)¶

Returns a new ArgumentList object created from the given arguments and flags.

Parameters

  • arguments – The list of arguments to read.

  • flags – The list of valid flags.

  • pos (expected) – The expected number of positional arguments. Once that number of positional arguments is read, the following positional arguments will be set as junk.

Returns

A new ArgumentList object.

utils.Flag module¶

class utils.Flag.Flag¶

Bases: object

This class is used to list all the possible flags in a command (non positional arguments).

add_flag(flag, nb_args)¶

Adds the given flag to the list of flags and sets its number of expected arguments. This command fails if the flag is already in the list.

Parameters

  • flag – The flag to add.

  • nb_args – The number of expected arguments for this flag.

Returns

True if the flag was successfully added, false otherwise.

exist_flag(flag)¶

Checks if a given flag is already in the list.

Parameters

flag – The flag to check the existence of.

Returns

True if the flag is in the list, False otherwise.

get_number_of_args(flag)¶

Returns the expected number of arguments bound to this flag.

Parameters

flag – The flag to get the number of arguments of.

Returns

The number of arguments expected for this flag if is in the list, -1 otherwise.

Simple queue class.

Returns

utils.Utils module¶

async utils.Utils.build_help(commands)¶

Creates a string correspoding to the default help returned by the bot.

Parameters

commands – The list commands defined for the bot.

Returns

A string corresponding to the default help of the bot.

utils.Utils.execute(command)¶

Executes a bash command.

Parameters

command – The bash command to execute.

async utils.Utils.get_all_command_modules()¶

Returns the list of modules corresponding to a Command.

Returns

A list of modules.

utils.Utils.get_element(driver, xpath, max_timeout=5)¶

Gets an element from the browser given its XPATH.

Parameters

  • driver – The webbrowser to use.

  • xpath – The XPATH of the element to get.

  • max_timeout – The maximum amount of time to wait before aborting.

Returns

An element of the page.

async utils.Utils.get_title(driver)¶

Get the title of the Geoguessr map.

Parameters

driver – The browser to use.

Returns

A string corresponding to the title of the map.

Converts an int to a corresponding time.

Parameters

Returns

The corresponding string.

async utils.Utils.is_logged(driver)¶

Checks if the user is logged in Geoguessr.

Parameters

driver – The web browser to check in.

Returns

True if the user is logged in, False otherwise.

Parameters

url – The URL to test.

Returns

True if the URL is valid, False otherwise.

async utils.Utils.load_shortcuts(bot)¶

Loads all the shortcuts from the shortcuts.txt file.

Parameters

bot – The bot to load the shortcuts in.

async utils.Utils.log(driver)¶

Logs the user in Geoguessr.

Parameters

driver – The webbrowser to log in.

async utils.Utils.save_shortcuts(bot)¶

Saves the current list of shortcuts stored in the bot.

Parameters

bot – The bot to read the shortcuts from.

async utils.Utils.time_to_int(value)¶

Converts a string representing a time value to an int.

Parameters

value – The string to convert, can either be a string representing a normal int or a string of the format min:sec.

Returns

The correspoding integer if possible, NAN otherwise.
